H2790.def: = causative action by which someone makes incised marks on a surface of wood or stone with the help of a sharp and hard tool

H339.def: = area located near the sea and/or the people living there; ≈ associated with commerce, remoteness, paganism, but also called on to acknowledge YHWH

H3816.def: = a large body of people united by common descent, religion, or language

H2498.def: = process by which an object appears in a certain location

H3581.def: = state in which humans, animals or deities have the ability to perform actions, or to prevail in, or endure situations that require the exertion or mustering of effort or force

H5066.def: = state in which objects are close to other objects in space

H227.def: = referent pointing to a specific point in time, either in the past or the future

H1696.def: = causative action by which someone exterminates a group of people, either directly or by the hands of someone else

H7126.def: = action by which humans or animals move to a location relatively close to the location in focus

H4941.def: = a situation where one party has a dispute with another party, and is looking for a legal ruling in which they receive what they consider to be rightfully theirs

H4310.def: = a reference to an unknown person or deity; normally used with the purpose of identifying that person or deity; sometimes used in rhetorical questions expressing one's conviction that that person or deity cannot be identified

H5782.def: = process by which someone wakes up from his sleep

H4217.def: literally: the rising  (of the sun): = a cardinal direction indicating the direction of the rising sun

H7121.def: = action by which humans or deities speak with a loud voice, often to draw attention to themselves or to their situation and expecting someone to respond in one way or another

H7272.def: = the lower part of the lower limb of the body of humans, animals, and --by extension-- of deities, which in some contexts may include the full leg; ► used for standing and walking; ≈ associated with authority, and also used as a euphemism for the male genitals

H6664.def: = state in which a weight or measure is correct or accurate, in accordance with a standard

H7287.def: = action by which humans or deities exercise authority over (other) humans, animals, and areas, often with focus on the manner in which this is done

H4428.def: = supreme secular and male ruler of a nation or people; ≈ associated with authority, power, honor, but also with justice; also used as a reference to one's deity

H6083.def: = the loose natural substance of the earth's surface

H2719.def: = sharp object; ◄ made out of iron or flint; ► used as tool for various purposes

H5086.def: = process by which the wind causes objects to be moved from one place to the other

H7179.def: = dry grass-like remnant of wheat or another grain crop following the harvest; this term possibly refers to two kinds of material, one being the remnant of the crop remaining in the ground, the other being the unwanted residue of stalks; ► only used for brick making; ≈ usually considered of little value and needing to be separated from the grain itself; maybe burned

H7198.def: = a strong but flexible piece of wood to which a string is attached for the firing of arrows, ► used for hunting or as weapon of war

H7291.def: = action by which humans go behind (other) humans or animals, usually at an increased speed

H734.def: = relatively narrow {L:road<SDBH:דֶּרֶךְ>} that connects two locations and facilitates travelling

H7272.def: = the lower part of the lower limb of the body of humans, animals, and --by extension-- of deities, which in some contexts may include the full leg; ► used for standing and walking; ≈ associated with authority, and also used as a euphemism for the male genitals

H4310.def: = a reference to an unknown person or deity; normally used with the purpose of identifying that person or deity; sometimes used in rhetorical questions expressing one's conviction that that person or deity cannot be identified

H6466.def: = action by which a person or deity carries out some purposeful activity, in order to create something or cause something to happen

H6213.def: = causative action by which human or deities produce an object, either personally or by others on behalf of them

H7121.def: = action by which humans or deities speak with a loud voice, often to draw attention to themselves or to their situation and expecting someone to respond in one way or another

H7218.def: = upper part of the human body, or the front or upper part of the body of an animal, typically separated from the rest of the body by a neck, and containing the brain, mouth, and sense organs; ≈ associated with the entire person, that person's life, and that person's responsibilities

H589.def: = referent to the speaker or writer in a discourse

H3068.def: = deity; ► God of Israel who revealed himself to Moses

H7223.def: = state in which a countable entity is the first or the previous in a range

H854.def: exact meaning unknown; possibly: = wooden handle with an iron head that has both an adze and a chisel as its ends; ► used for breaking up moderately hard soil to make it ready for cultivation

H314.def: = pertaining to being located behind other objects in a row

H339.def: = area located near the sea and/or the people living there; ≈ associated with commerce, remoteness, paganism, but also called on to acknowledge YHWH

H7200.def: = process or action by which living creatures perceive something, primarily --though not necessarily exclusively-- with their eyes, either as a spontaneous incident or as the result of focusing the eyes on something

H3372.def: = state in which humans experience fear

H776.def: = the earth as opposed to the sky; sometimes used in a more specific sense to denote part of the earth, such as the dry land as opposed to the sea, or a specific region, area, country, or plot of land

H2729.def: = state/process by which inanimate objects shake or tremble violently

H7126.def: = action by which humans or animals move to a location relatively close to the location in focus

H5826.def: = process by which humans receive assistance or supported from other humans or deities

H7453.def: = the non-verbal sounds made by a large group of people in response to a situation, either positively or negatively

H559.def: = action by which humans and deities utter words; this can happen within their minds and be inaudible to others, but in most cases the words are spoken out loud in order to communicate something to others; usually directly followed by the actual words that are spoken

H251.def: = son of one's father, whether from the same mother or not

H2388.def: = state in which humans or deities are strong in a physical, political, or military sense, or simply in their ability to convince others with words

14.gl: a man ... his brother > one ... each other

H2796.def: = person with the skill to produce an artifact out of rough materials, such as stone, wood, metal

H2388.def: = state in which humans or deities are strong in a physical, political, or military sense, or simply in their ability to convince others with words

H6884.def: = action by which humans or deities examine the character of humans by having them engage in a certain activity, ◄ as a goldsmith tests the quality of a precious metal by smelting it in the fire

H2505.def: = causative action by which humans or deities divide an object (or range of objects) into portions; ► usually with the intention to use one or more of these portions for a particular purpose

H6360.def: = instrument of about 30 centimeters long, consisting of a handle, usually made of wood, to which was attached a stone, wooden, or (less frequently) metal head; ► used for many purposes, including the breaking or dressing of building stones, pounding nails or pegs into wood, or pounding pegs into the ground; also used by blacksmiths to shape hot metal

H1986.def: = action by which humans or animals deliver a blow to an object with their hands, whether or not with the help of an instrument such as a {L:hammer<SDBH:הַלְמוּת>}, or with their feet

H6471.def: = the lower part of the leg beyond the ankle, on which humans or animals stand and with which they walk

H559.def: = action by which humans and deities utter words; this can happen within their minds and be inaudible to others, but in most cases the words are spoken out loud in order to communicate something to others; usually directly followed by the actual words that are spoken

H1694.def: = area where two objects have been joined together permanently

H4131.def: = state in which an object is not firmly fixed to the surface on which it stands so that it can move or slip; to waver

H3478.def: = man, also known as {L:Jacob<SDBH:יַעֲקֹב>} and {L:Jeshurun<SDBH:יְשֻׁרוּן>}, including the ethnic group that is regarded to be his descendants; ◄ son of {L:Isaac<SDBH:יִצְחָק>} and {L:Rebekah<SDBH:רִבְקָה>}, brother of {L:Esau<SDBH:עֵשָׂו>}, and ► father of twelve sons -- after whom the tribes of Israel were named -- and one daughter

H5650.def: = man who is under the authority of someone else as that person's legal property, employee, subject, or vassal; or someone who presents himself as such when speaking to someone of importance or praying to God

H3290.def: = man, also known as {L:Israel<SDBH:יִשְׂרָאֵל>} and {L:Jeshurun<SDBH:יְשֻׁרוּן>}; ◄ second son of {L:Isaac<SDBH:יִצְחָק>}; ► one of the patriarchs of {L:Israel<SDBH:יִשְׂרָאֵל>}; in poetic texts often used as a reference to the entire people of Israel

H834.def: = a linker introducing a proposition that gives additional information regarding an explicit or implicit object, location, time, or manner

H977.def: = action by which someone makes a selection among several options, which include humans, divine beings, animals, other objects, or events

H2233.def: = a flowering plant’s unit of reproduction, capable of developing into another such plant, in some cases also used as food

H85.def: = man, also known as {L:Abram<SDBH:אַבְרָם>}; ◄ son of {L:Terah<SDBH:תֶּרַח>}; ► first patriarch of {L:Israel<SDBH:יִשְׂרָאֵל>}; father of {L:Ishmael<SDBH:יִשְׁמָעֵאל>} and {L:Isaac<SDBH:יִצְחָק>}

H1758.def: = causative action by which humans separate grain from straw by having animals trample it or by dragging a threshing board over it; ≈ often used figuratively to denote acts of aggression

H1854.def: = state in which an object has been reduced to fine particles

H1389.def: = an elevation of the earth’s surface rising gradually and to a relatively small height from the surrounding level; generally lower than a {L:mountain<SDBH:הַר>}

H4671.def: = debris and husks crushed and separated from grain and carried away by the wind when threshing and winnowing ≈ associated especially with the transient nature and disappearance of evil people and enemies.

H7307.def: = an invisible being that is in a direct relation to and under control of God and one of his manifestation, often described as a substance that can be poured out, ► through whom the universe is created and animated; it can manifest itself as an invisible force equipping humans with wisdom, skill, and strength for specific tasks; it can also manifest itself as a movement of air through the bodies of animate creatures (breath) or through nature (wind)

H369.def: = state in which an object or event is either absent or non-existant

H1237.def: = a more or less flat and relatively low region, usually between uplands, hills or mountains, and following the course of a stream

H7760.def: = action by which individuals or groups of humans place themselves in a certain position or configuration

H4057.def: = area not very suitable for sedentary life and agriculture because of its lack of water; suitable for grazing domestic animals and only inhabited by nomadic tribes and wild animals

H98.def: = small body of stagnant water, usually in swampy area; ≈ seen as a blessing when contrasted with the desert, but as a curse when contrasted with a developed area

H4325.def: = water as the indispensible liquid on which the existence of all life depends, used for drinking, preparing food, washing, irrigating, etc.; found under the earth, on the earth, and above the earth; sometimes used as a euphemism to denote certain body liquids; ≈ associated with abundance and refreshment, but also with instability, and danger, etc.

H6723.def: = state in which there is a lack of water or rainfall, ► resulting in lack of vegetation and other desert-like conditions

H776.def: = the earth as opposed to the sky; sometimes used in a more specific sense to denote part of the earth, such as the dry land as opposed to the sea, or a specific region, area, country, or plot of land

H4161.def: = action by which humans, deities, plants, or objects leave or emerge from a certain place or position

H730.def: = evergreen tree growing up to 40 m tall, with a trunk up to 2.5 m in diameter; as it grows older its branches spread out more and more horizontally; grows in elevated places; ◄ Cedrus libani; ► highly appreciated building material; also used in cleaning ritual; ≈ associated with beauty, quality, pride, and strength

H4057.def: = area not very suitable for sedentary life and agriculture because of its lack of water; suitable for grazing domestic animals and only inhabited by nomadic tribes and wild animals

H7848.def: = a desert tree, reaching a height of 3-5 m, with a wide crown; it has sharp spines, finely divided leaves, and tiny pale yellow flowers arranged in drooping bunches; it produces a bean pod that is twisted and looped when dry; ◄ a member of the Mimosa family, Acacia tortilis or Acacia raddiana; ► its wood is used for construction

H1918.def: = an evergreen tree or bush, up to 1.5 m. high; dark glossy leaves are dense on the branches, and the flowers are white or pink; the whole plant gives off an agreeable odor; ► used by the Jews in the Feast of Tabernacles; regarded as a desirable tree, as opposed to thorns and thistles

H8081.def: = high quality {L:oil<SDBH:שֶׁמֶן>}, ◄ extracted from the fruits of the olive tree during the first pressing; ► used as food, medicine, fuel, perfume (when mixed with spices), and other purposes; also used in various religious rituals; ≈ associated with joy, but also known for its softness, smoothness, and elusiveness

H6086.def: = any kind of tall, woody plant that grows from a single trunk and with several lateral branches that often bear leaves and fruit

H7760.def: = action by which individuals or groups of humans place themselves in a certain position or configuration

H1265.def: exact meaning unsure: = one of the evergreen trees commonly found in the Lebanon, with round leaves rather than flat; its fruit is a a mostly inedible seed-bearing, fleshy cone; ≈ regarded as one of the glorious trees of the Lebanon

H8410.def: = sturdy evergreen shrub that reaches 3.5 m in height, with dark green, shiny leaves, white flowers, and poisonous purple berries; ◄ Viburnum tinus; ≈ regarded as one of the glorious trees of the Lebanon

H4100.def: = a reference to an unknown object or event; normally used with the purpose of identifying that object; sometimes used in rhetorical questions expressing one's conviction that that object or event cannot be identified

H7760.def: = action by which individuals or groups of humans place themselves in a certain position or configuration

H3820.def: = the organ located in the centre of the human body that pumps the blood through our circulatory system, ≈ seen as the seat of knowledge, human reasoning, planning, intelligence, skill, affection and hatred, desire and satisfaction, humility and pride, courage and fear, joy and grief

H3045.def: = process by which humans or deities acquire information about other humans, deities, or certain facts, which is stored in the mind

H319.def: = pertaining to being located far behind other objects in a row, in a direction away from the spectator; ≈ since the way the ancient Israelites oriented themselves was with their backs facing the East, this term presupposes a westerly direction

H176.def: = particle linking two entities by which X and Y are alternative options that exclude each other

H5046.def: = causative action by which humans pass on information to others, usually by word of mouth

H857.def: = to move to a certain location, seen from that location's perspective

H268.def: = the side or part of something away from the spectator or from the direction in which it moves or faces

H3045.def: = process by which humans or deities acquire information about other humans, deities, or certain facts, which is stored in the mind

H430.def: plural with plural meaning: = generic term for a supernatural being, worshiped by individuals or entire nations

H637.def: = the two external openings in the nose

H3190.def: = causative action by which humans cause objects to be in a better state of maintenance than before

H7489.def: literally: to make (one's deeds) wrong; hence: = action by which humans behave in an evil or harmful way

H7200.def: = process or action by which living creatures perceive something, primarily --though not necessarily exclusively-- with their eyes, either as a spontaneous incident or as the result of focusing the eyes on something

H369.def: = state in which an object or event is either absent or non-existant

H6467.def: = an activity performed by a person or deity

H659.def: = object of small or no value

H977.def: = action by which someone makes a selection among several options, which include humans, divine beings, animals, other objects, or events

H8441.def: = state in which an event is considered utterly wrong and detestable

H5782.def: = process by which someone wakes up from his sleep

H6828.def: = a mountain, identified with Jebel ʾel-Aqraʿ ◄ in northern Syria, ► known by the Canaanites as the mountain of the gods

H857.def: = to move to a certain location, seen from that location's perspective

H4217.def: literally: the rising  (of the sun): = a cardinal direction indicating the direction of the rising sun

H8121.def: = celestial body ► that marks day and night and produces warmth and light for the earth

H7121.def: = action by which humans or deities speak with a loud voice, often to draw attention to themselves or to their situation and expecting someone to respond in one way or another

H8034.def: = one or more words by which a person, deity, place or object is known, addressed, remembered, or referred to; ≈ regarded as a core element of one's identity

H3644.def: = fire; ≈ associated with God's punishment, which is too heavy for humans to bear

H2563.def: = stiff tenacious earth; ► material of which bricks, pottery, and even man himself is made; ≈ buildings made with this material are regarded as relatively weak as opposed to buildings made of stone; therefore it is also seen as relatively worthless material

H7429.def: = action by which humans, deities, or animals tread heavily and noisily on people, plants, or objects; ► usually with the purpose of killing, destroying, desecrating, and/or humiliating

H2916.def: = wet soil;◄ moistened by rain or because of its proximity to a body of water; ► can be used for pottery or bricks; ≈ regarded as cheap, easily obtainable and workable material for making basic items; otherwise as a valueless substance or an obstacle for movement

H4310.def: = a reference to an unknown person or deity; normally used with the purpose of identifying that person or deity; sometimes used in rhetorical questions expressing one's conviction that that person or deity cannot be identified

H5046.def: = causative action by which humans pass on information to others, usually by word of mouth

H7218.def: = upper part of the human body, or the front or upper part of the body of an animal, typically separated from the rest of the body by a neck, and containing the brain, mouth, and sense organs; ≈ associated with the entire person, that person's life, and that person's responsibilities

H3045.def: = process by which humans or deities acquire information about other humans, deities, or certain facts, which is stored in the mind

H559.def: = action by which humans and deities utter words; this can happen within their minds and be inaudible to others, but in most cases the words are spoken out loud in order to communicate something to others; usually directly followed by the actual words that are spoken

H6662.def: = state in which a person's or deity's behavior is fully consistent with the requirements of the law, either in a specific matter that is under dispute or as one's general mode of behavior

H637.def: = the two external openings in the nose

H369.def: = state in which an object or event is either absent or non-existant

H561.def: = words spoken by humans and deities; often remembered and recorded

H7223.def: = state in which a countable entity is the first or the previous in a range

H6726.def: = mountain; ► that part of {L:Jerusalem<SDBH:יְרוּשָׁלַ͏ִם>} on which the temple was built, also known as a fortress and stronghold, city of {L:David<SDBH:דָּוִד>}, YHWH's dwelling place

H3389.def: = town, formerly referred to as {L:Salem<SDBH:שָׁלֵם>} and {L:Jebus<SDBH:יְבוּס>};◄ located on Mt. {L:Zion<SDBH:צִיֹּון>}; territory of {L:Judah<SDBH:יְהוּדָה>}; ► conquered by king {L:David<SDBH:דָּוִד>}, who made it the capital of his kingdom

H1319.def: = action by which humans pass on information to someone else, having been commissioned to do so by a deity or another person

H7200.def: = process or action by which living creatures perceive something, primarily --though not necessarily exclusively-- with their eyes, either as a spontaneous incident or as the result of focusing the eyes on something

H369.def: = state in which an object or event is either absent or non-existant

H3289.def: = action by which humans or deities exercise their minds to determine how they are going to achieve a particular purpose

H428.def: = marker identifying a set of multiple objects with a set that already exists in the mind of the hearers

H7725.def: = action by which humans face a direction different from the one they were facing before

H4639.def: = an activity performed by a person or deity

H5262.def: = a physical likeness or representation of a person, animal, or thing; ◄ made by pouring molten metal into a mold; ► functions as an object of non-sanctioned worship

H8414.def: = location that is devoid of any life and without any structure or order

H7307.def: = an invisible being that is in a direct relation to and under control of God and one of his manifestation, often described as a substance that can be poured out, ► through whom the universe is created and animated; it can manifest itself as an invisible force equipping humans with wisdom, skill, and strength for specific tasks; it can also manifest itself as a movement of air through the bodies of animate creatures (breath) or through nature (wind)
